article_title: For U.N., Pope Plans Tightly Crafted Speech
article_text:
In his speech to the United Nations this month, Pope Francis will likely focus on the environment, poverty, migration, economic inequality and the Iran nuclear deal, according to a Vatican official.

Archbishop Bernardito C. Auza, the Holy See’s representative to the United Nations, said during a news conference Wednesday that in addition to the pope’s 30- to 35-minute address, he will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin, other...

twitter.description: The pope’s emerging U.N. speech covers poverty, migration, the Iran nuclear deal and more—assuming he sticks to the script.
